meanings.definition: To surpass in cooking skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: She always outcooks her friends at baking cookies.
meanings.sent2: My grandma outcooks everyone in making delicious pies.
meanings.sent3: The cooking competition was fierce, but she managed to outcook them all.
meanings.sent4: Her culinary skills outcooking others are truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: Watching her outcooking the professional chefs was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of cooking better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her outcooking of the famous chef surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The outcooking at the family barbecue was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent3: His outcooking of the school cafeteria food made him quite popular.
meanings.sent4: The outcooking competition brought out the best in all the participants.
meanings.sent5: The outcooking skills of the new chef were unmatched in the restaurant.

meanings.definition: The result or consequence of cooking.
meanings.sent1: The delicious aroma was the outcooking of her efforts in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The burnt dish was an unfortunate outcooking of his distraction.
meanings.sent3: The outcooking of the dinner party was a success with everyone enjoying the meal.
meanings.sent4: The outcooking of the recipe led to a mouthwatering dish.
meanings.sent5: The outcooking of the potluck was evident in the empty serving dishes.
